message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with information dissemination in parallel and distributed computing, which is a core topic in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The use of randomized protocols and the analysis of their performance in random graphs suggest that the paper could also fit in the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-categories. The consideration of replicated databases and peer-to-peer networks expands the scope to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the analytical and empirical study of communication overhead and algorithmic modifications suggest that the paper could also be relevant to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
